ratings.comment: Easiest class ever. Finished with 100+%. English isn't her first language so some words are tough to hear, but overall not bad. Anyone giving her a bad review just didn't attend lecture or discussion because we practically went over test problems. More than fair grader and gives good feedback online. She provides plenty of practice for exams too.

If you're already pretty good at math, you might be able to handle Professor Hu's class. But if you're struggling and need extra help, I would suggest looking elsewhere. The lack of clear instruction and engagement can make it tough to succeed, and it's easy to become discouraged and frustrated.

Professor Hu's math class has been challenging. She teaches in a monotone and detached manner, often with her head down as she writes on her iPad. She doesn't seem to engage with the students or show much interest in our learning. It feels like we're being taught by a substitute teacher, and this has been the case throughout the entire semester.

Dr. Hu is very knowledgeable in her field and can answer most questions satisfactorily, but it is often best to wait for office hours instead. In addition, her accent is very strong, which makes it challenging to understand the material. She does try to engage the class, but often she lectures on theorems and laws without enough examples.

Has excellent lecture notes which are easy to understand and uploaded to canvas, accessible outside of class, 1 homework assignment every week which complements her lecture material and is an excellent tool to study for exams, always looking for ways to improve her class.

Jiuhua is overall a great professor. Exams are straightforward, if you go to lecture and do the homework getting an A isn't very hard. She is accessible outside of class and Piazza questions are answered promptly. Definitely recommend taking her for 320

The worst organization in a class that I have taken so far. Lectures were not worth my time, but regardless of teaching ability, her emails make no sense, exams don't align with other 320 classes, and I felt like I got no knowledge out of the class. I would recommend the other professors for 320.

When I went to my first 320 Lecture I thought the course would be a nightmare. However, it turned out to be the opposite. She is a very good math professor, she is caring and wants her students to succeed.

Professor Hu has an amazing way in which she lectures in. She is very lighthearted and is almost always smiling. 

The way she lectures is very straightforward. She shows her blank notes and then fills them out clearly and concisely. In addition, she focuses more on differential equations in 320, so expect lots of those.

absolutely loved her! she was so clear with what she expected on each exam and her notes were so neat. have always been okay at math, but never had a professor that explained things as well as her! she really helped make things click and any points that I would get off on exams were totally understandable! do the homework! it helps a lot:)
Homeworks are always the best tool for reviewing exams. Lectures explain theorem well.
Difficulty for the exam is fair. Extra credits were available and we can also drop one of the lowest. Not much homework, and it was an good experience
Very Great Class, good teaching, no much hw press, easy test, good note and review sheet.

Jiahua Hu simply focuses on the wrong things such as extremely complicated theorems that will never actually be tested on. Be prepared to learn everything either on your own like Kahn Academy or some TA's office hours. The exams are all of the grade + easy homework yet the help Jiahua gives for reviewing for exams wasn't enough to do well.

Required homework was nice as it was only a few problems, but there are more optional problems if you want more practice. Prof Hu is not a good lecturer, and explained the concepts poorly, most of the time she would just transcribe the textbook's definitions or go through long, unnecessary proofs. I had Ben as a TA, he was really great.

On my first midterm I got a 30/40 through just attendance in the class and discussion-- class average 32. The second midterm I purely focused on learning through Khan Academy, and my second midterm grade became a 37/40-- class average 31. I think that explains enough. She's abrasive when the class is quiet and doesn't explain anything conceptually

Hu is the least intuitive and easy to understand professors I've had at UW. She rarely strays from explicit definitions in the book. She doesn't use examples and shows no emotion in lecture. This makes me feel she doesn't have a deep grasp or interest in the subject itself. Other prof exam average is way higher, I wonder why! Skip her.

Professor Jiuhua Hu goes over concepts at a good pace in lectures and writes good notes, however, she is at times hard to understand. She only teaches the easier parts of this class, making you have to figure out the harder parts on your own. Canvas page is very disorganized and bare bones. Ended up teaching myself more of the class than she did.
